metadata.rationale: Extracted from canonical script and scene co-occurrence data.

data.description: Laynah is a 30-something, broad-shouldered, fake-breasted broker at Bel Inc. who dresses in high-end country club wear. She is territorial, status-conscious, and openly hostile toward newcomers she perceives as threats, particularly Dante. She operates within the firm's boys-club culture, performing femininity and compliance when it serves her (e.g., entertaining clients) while wielding social cruelty as a power tool against other women.
data.dialogue_summary: Laynah's dialogue is consistently hostile, self-serving, or performative. She opens by privately branding Dante 'Dominican street trash,' then challenges Abe's hiring decision using misogynistic language she has absorbed from the firm's culture. In the corridor she feigns warmth while immediately pivoting to steal credit for Daniels' account. On the trading floor she frames a humiliating 'welcome gift' (a disheveled Yuri) as a joke at Dante's expense. In the VIP room she inserts herself into the group, deflects Joaquin's groping with mild irritation, and fails to register Dante's genuine attempt at female solidarity.

explicit_evidence.quote: LAYNAH, a 30-something broad-shouldered, fake-breasted broker dressed in high-end country club wear.
explicit_evidence.source_scene: INT. BEL INC. EMPTY WASHROOM - EARLY MORNING

explicit_evidence.quote: Who the HELL is that Dominican street trash?
explicit_evidence.source_scene: INT. BEL INC. EMPTY WASHROOM - EARLY MORNING

explicit_evidence.quote: I thought we had a freeze on hiring more women. Something about 'bleeding, cramps and no more mat leave'?
explicit_evidence.trait: Sexist and complicit in workplace misogyny

explicit_evidence.quote: Laynah's scowl has turned into a large, fake and tight smile... 'Welcome to the family... Dante.'
explicit_evidence.trait: Fake and performatively welcoming in public

explicit_evidence.quote: Abe wants to take me out for dinner tomorrow night, with Mr. Daniels, to thank me for helping save his account.
This one is a welcome present for our 'new broker'... You may wanna have Greta take this one to the cleaners first.
explicit_evidence.source_scene: INT. 2ND LEVEL TRADING PIT - DANTE'S DESK

explicit_evidence.quote: She has changed her shirt so that her fake boobs are bursting out the impossibly small bodice she's stretched over them. She has clearly re-done her make-up, hair, and outfit.
Laynah, as usual, doesn't understand, and pretends to rub her front teeth right back, as though mocking Dante's actions. Although, she doesn't quite touch her teeth, so they stay stained.
explicit_evidence.trait: Oblivious to social cues / lacks self-awareness

inferred_traits.rationale: Laynah immediately reacts with hostility upon encountering Dante, complains to Abe about hiring women, and fabricates credit for saving Daniels' account — all behaviors consistent with protecting her position as the dominant female broker.
inferred_traits.trait: Territorial about status within the firm

inferred_traits.rationale: She accepts Abe's order to 'look slutty' and attend Daniels as an escort-adjacent role without visible protest, and she re-dresses provocatively for the VIP room, suggesting she has internalized the transactional use of her sexuality as a career tool.

Her immediate, visceral reaction to Dante's arrival, her need to reapply makeup and change outfits before the VIP room, and her credit-stealing suggest an underlying anxiety about her position rather than genuine confidence.
She misreads Dante's teeth-rubbing gesture as mockery rather than a friendly warning, and she fails to notice lipstick on her own teeth — both pointing to poor social attunement.

data.name: LAYNAH

relationships.evidence: Immediately labels Dante 'street trash,' attempts to undermine her welcome, stages a humiliating desk prank, and misreads her olive-branch gesture.
She reports to Abe, accepts his demeaning instructions (look 'sluttier,' escort Daniels), and seeks his approval while he dismisses her concerns without eye contact.
Joaquin buries his face in her cleavage and grabs at her; she slaps him away and tells him to 'screw off' but remains in the booth — suggesting a familiar, if uncomfortable, dynamic.
Greta ignores Laynah's cruel comment about Yuri, and Laynah treats Greta as a personal assistant (ordering her to make reservations).

scene_presence: INT. BEL INC. EMPTY WASHROOM - EARLY MORNING
INT. 2ND LEVEL TRADING PIT - DANTE'S DESK
